parameters: \pop[3]Ooooh, are we interrupting any private time?
\i[1]"Just in the kitchen making some food."
\i[2]"In my bedroom, wanna come join me?"
\pop[4]Not much of a team player, huh?
I thought we were all in this together.
\i[1]"Just in the kitchen making some food."
I'll be forever in your debt, I swear.
\i[2]"In my bedroom, wanna come join me?"
\pop[4]If you mean for a writing jam, sure.
This whole "paranoia" thing is a real mood-killer.
\pop[4]Yeah. I'm really glad we can split up when we're at home.
I could never write with all your prying eyes on me.
Is there a secret you could share?
\pop[3]Been approached to write an autobiography, though.
I considered it, but I wouldn't even know where to start.
\pop[3]Is that why you're constantly writing in that diary?
This is a pretty big trip for me, after all.
\pop[3]Wait. You're writing about all of us?
\pop[3]Am I the only one who thinks that's a bad idea?
\pop[3]Why would it be a bad idea?
Like, a tome of all this treason?
\pop[4]I can see how that might be problematic. But remember, we're not gonna get caught.
And when things end in favor of the \c[10]zeros\c[0]? Those will just be notes about how the world changed.
\pop[3]I'm not writing about that kinda stuff, actually...
I wouldn't do anything that could end up harming us.
Anyway Klace, I don't know if I can help.
I'm more of a fiction writer than anything else.
\pop[4]Maybe that's because you never go outside.
Plus, it makes me a lot of money, too.
But then again, I'm not really creative.
\pop[4]You spend all day tinkering in your workshop, though.
Technology can require \c[14]just\c[0] as much creativity.
\pop[4]It's more like... optimization than anything else.
Gotta make sure everything is excessively efficient.
\pop[4]Well, writing is kind of the same.
A story is nothing if it's not efficient.
I fine-tune my stuff almost every day.
And speaking of which, could you all stay out of my workshop?
I'm working on a surprise, and it's not ready just yet.
\pop[3]At least he didn't use the "House of Isaac" line again.
But I'll show you the surprise soon enough.
\pop[3]As long as it doesn't make anything worse.
\pop[4]Come on, how could things get any worse?
